comment_data.body:
I apologise for the bad info. I had conflated `WorkspaceEdits` and `TextDocumentContentChangeEvent` which are handled differently (the former all describe locations in the original document, but the latter are applied sequentially).

I've opened https://github.com/dart-lang/sdk/issues/61501 for the underlying issue, and don't believe there's anything wrong in Neovim here.
to be clear, I will close this issue when the upstream one will be closed with any outcome and reflect it here.
Looks like dart has closed their issue
Yep, the fix landed in Dart and should also be in Flutter's master channel now. If you're able to test it out there, please let me know if you still see any issues.
@lumpsoid it looks like you're on Flutter's stable channel, but the fix is only currently in the master channel.

@DanTup Oh right, that's what I missed. 

Changed to the master channel
```
flutter --version
Flutter 3.37.0-1.0.pre-227 ‚Ä¢ channel master ‚Ä¢ https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git
Framework ‚Ä¢ revision a92ec1c185 (3 hours ago) ‚Ä¢ 2025-09-22 14:47:10 -0700
Engine ‚Ä¢ hash 27b24ceef0343da907c9d97d148488ddc71880c2 (revision c0e7d716c5) (2 hours ago) ‚Ä¢ 2025-09-22 20:14:02.000Z
Tools ‚Ä¢ Dart 3.10.0 (build 3.10.0-227.0.dev) ‚Ä¢ DevTools 2.50.0
```

Have no errors with the same routine.

Thanks for your work! Sorry for confusion.
Much love ‚ù§Ô∏è
@lumpsoid no problem, thank you for testing and confirming! üôÇ

title: LSP: dart `textDocument/didChange` Notifications Sent with Incorrect Ranges
